alert.note: Alert for San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 12:36PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... San Juan River At Shiprock affecting San Juan County. San Juan River Near Archuleta affecting San Juan County. San Juan River At Farmington affecting San Juan County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...High flows in the river are expected, with possible overbank flow in low lying areas. * WHERE...San Juan River at Farmington. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 5.4 feet this afternoon. It will then rise to 6.1 feet early Tuesday morning. It will fall to 6.0 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then rise to 6.4 feet early Thursday morning. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon around 200 PM MDT.
